items.sentence: It would never have occurred to me to say anything like that.
Mary held out her hand to show everybody her engagement ring.
Tom and Mary couldn\'t go on a picnic because it was raining.
I could never have imagined that something like this existed.
I did what I had to do, and if I had to do it again, I would.
Parents are usually concerned about their children\'s future.
Tom called her Mary even though that wasn\'t really her name.
Tom came from a family who didn\'t talk about their feelings.
Tom thinks Mary doesn\'t have an inkling of what\'s going on.
Tom described how he was able to escape from the locked room.
The box was so heavy that Tom had to help Mary carry it home.
The house burned to the ground before the fire truck arrived.
The months with the most rain are May, June, July and August.
The only time my son talks to me is when he needs some money.
If you feed your dog properly, you can increase his lifespan.
Tom lived in his car for a while after he broke up with Mary.
Tom lives in the woods without electricity and running water.
Tom looks happier today than he did last week when I saw him.
Tom meets his girlfriend at this coffee shop every afternoon.
Tom might not want to sing in front of such a large audience.
Tom might want to eat something when he finishes working out.
I don\'t know when I\'ll see Tom again, but I\'m sure I will.
It\'s hard to predict what the weather will be like tomorrow.
It\'s so hot that you could cook an egg on the hood of a car.
Last night there was a fire near here, and I couldn\'t sleep.
That job wasn\'t very interesting. However, the pay was good.
Tom speaks to his father in French and his mother in English.
Tom thought he would be able to do what Mary asked him to do.
Tom threw away all the old newspapers that were in the attic.
Tom told his son the story about a monster that ate children.
Tom told me you were planning to go to Boston in three weeks.
Tom took a blanket off the bed and wrapped it around himself.
Tom didn\'t realize he shouldn\'t be doing what he was doing.
Tom doesn\'t have to wash the car. Mary\'s already washed it.
Tom doesn\'t think Mary\'s French pronunciation is very good.
Tom ate by himself even though he had hoped to eat with Mary.
Tom ate the free bread and then walked out of the restaurant.
Put your hand over your mouth when you cough, sneeze or yawn.
The man in the back of the pickup truck started firing at us.
Tom and Mary plan to be together for the rest of their lives.
I just got a letter from someone that I knew a long time ago.
If you know what needs to be done, please go ahead and do it.
It irritates Tom when Mary leaves the cap off the toothpaste.
I can\'t believe that Tom was able to do this all by himself.
Tom wanted Mary to understand why he couldn\'t live with her.
Tom wanted to ask a question, but thought that he shouldn\'t.
Tom wanted to go to Boston, but his father wouldn\'t let him.
Tom said he wanted me to spend the summer in Boston with him.
Tom said he wanted to be alone, and then went up to his room.
In Japan, people legally become adults when they turn twenty.
